content.text:
# Create Pull Request

Based on the `Instructions` below, take the `Variables` follow the `Run` section to create a pull request. Then follow the `Report` section to report the results of your work.

## Variables

branch_name: $1
issue: $2
plan_file: $3
adw_id: $4

## Instructions

- Generate a pull request title in the format: `<issue_type>: #<issue_number> - <issue_title>`
- The PR body should include:
  - A summary section with the issue context
  - Link to the implementation plan file
  - Reference to the issue (Closes #<issue_number>)
  - ADW tracking ID
  - A checklist of what was done
  - A summary of key changes made
- Extract issue number, type, and title from the issue JSON
- Examples of PR titles:
  - `feat: #123 - Add user authentication`
  - `bug: #456 - Fix login validation error`
  - `chore: #789 - Update dependencies`

## Run

1. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --stat` to see a summary of changed files
2. Run `git log origin/main..HEAD --oneline` to see the commits that will be included
3. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --name-only` to get a list of changed files
4. Run `git push -u origin <branch_name>` to push the branch
5. Set GH_TOKEN environment variable from GITHUB_PAT if available, then run `gh pr create --title "<pr_title>" --body "<pr_body>" --base main` to create the PR
6. Capture the PR URL from the output

## Report

Return ONLY the PR URL that was created (no other text)

ARGUMENTS: bug-7-7b0f8cf5-fix-add-task-bugs {"number":7,"title":"Fix add task bugs","body":"/bug\n\nWhen I add a task it shows in the previous date.\n\nAlso, add right margin to the add new task modal (image attached)\n![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ba71673-4a66-452b-82ad-5e364cf75e62)","state":"OPEN","author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjYzNzk5MTg0","login":"juan-calou","name":"Juan Calou","is_bot":false},"assignees":[],"labels":[],"milestone":null,"comments":[],"createdAt":"2026-01-21T14:26:02Z","updatedAt":"2026-01-21T14:26:02Z","closedAt":null,"url":"https://github.com/juan-calou/tac-week-planner/issues/7"} specs/bug-7-fix-add-task-bugs.md 7b0f8cf5
I'll create a pull request for the bug fixes. Let me gather the necessary information and push the changes.

input.command:
export GH_TOKEN="${GITHUB_PAT}" && gh pr create --title "bug: #7 - Fix add task bugs" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

Fixes two bugs in the task creation functionality:
1. Tasks were being added to the previous date instead of the selected date
2. Modal lacked right margin causing spacing issues

**Implementation Plan:** [specs/bug-7-fix-add-task-bugs.md](specs/bug-7-fix-add-task-bugs.md)

Closes #7

**ADW ID:** 7b0f8cf5

## Changes Made

### Date Bug Fix
- Fixed date calculation in `app.component.ts` by using `getUTCDate()` instead of `getDate()` to handle timezone offsets correctly
- Ensured tasks are added to the correct date when creating them

### Modal Spacing Fix
- Added `margin-right: 20px` to the `.add-task-button` class in `app.component.css`
- Improved visual spacing of the "Add New Task" modal

## Key Files Changed
- `app/client/src/app/app.component.ts` - Fixed date calculation logic
- `app/client/src/app/app.component.css` - Added modal right margin
EOF
)" --base main
